Description: Fragment of a rectangular (?) limestone thick plaque with one corner preserved; underside flat with inscriptions roughly carved, apparently hieroglyphs (but difficult to read), and lines at right angle; top damaged, more irregular, with a raised part in the middle, broken off; if this part was a handle, the object might have been a stamp seal.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by World Museum, Liverpool. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The shape of the object recalls stamp-seal of the Ptolemaic period, bearing the names of Ptolemaic king and queen.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (PA.10)
